svg.title: Test: width:auto; height:49%; width="0" height="0"
svg.desc: This testcase checks that the intrinsic width will be taken as the used width when the CSS 'width' property is set to 'auto', the 'height' property is set to some other value, and there is no intrinsic ratio. Since the 'width' attribute is set to zero, nothing should be displayed. You should not see any red when viewing this file.
